text: Solely a concept video from what I can tell…it’s unclear what this thing actually is supposed to do, and it seems to have zero interface and rely solely on complex gestures, but it reminds me at least in form factor of the Owl.  <https://vimeo.com/175546306>

attachments.title: Bearbot
attachments.text:
Bearbot, a cute universal remote at your command.
Shot: Quentin WARDAVOIR
Edit: Vivien MULLER
Bearbot face animations: Laurent BOX
attachments.video_html: <iframe src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/175546306?autoplay=1" width="400" height="225" frameborder="0" title="Bearbot" webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen allowfullscreen></iframe>

text: Sort of ridiculous from a UX point of view, but at the same time all I've ever wanted is a pet bear to manage my life

the ux looks horrible, cute but horrible. no feedback as to what is going on. The bear smiles at me gently and maniacally as he turns the volume up to max on my stereo, while i meant to turn off the tv while when i got a phone call. I could see something like this happening easy
yeah i actually really hate videos like this, its like the IOT version of dribbble. Zero context, just something cute to look at.
but i do like the I.D. :slightly_smiling_face:
